dt: {bc}one that is under the protection of another {bc}{sx|dependent||}

dt.t: a first-rate power, able to defend her political {wi}clients{/wi} in central and eastern Europe

dt: {bc}a person who engages the professional advice or services of another

dt.t: a personal trainer … enjoyed the challenges of helping {wi}clients{/wi} buff up their bodies.

dt: {bc}a person served by or utilizing the services of a social agency
{bc}a computer in a network that uses the services (such as access to files or shared peripherals) provided by a server
{bc}software that allows a computer to function as a client in a network

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French & Latin; Anglo-French {it}client{/it}, from Latin {it}client-, cliens{/it}; perhaps akin to Latin {it}clinare{/it} to lean {ma}{mat|lean|}{/ma}
shortdef: one that is under the protection of another : dependent
a person who engages the professional advice or services of another
